title: Unconventional Reservoir Engineer Sr
description:
Specific Responsibilities
  
The Unconventional Reservoir Engineering Sr. role for Apache Corporation will be a member of Apache’s Reservoir Engineering team at the company’s Houston, TX office reporting to the Unconventional Function Lead. This person will work with a multi-disciplinary team responsible for the assessment and development of Apache’s domestic assets.
  
  

**This role will be primarily responsible for the following:**  

* Use unconventional reservoir engineering techniques and methodologies to inform and optimize field development and reservoir recovery
* Integrate rate and pressure transient analysis, material balance, decline curve and volumetric analyses into reservoir evaluation
* Build reservoir simulation models when appropriate to validate/improve predictions and quantify uncertainty
* Work with integrated team to develop and optimize completion, stimulation, and lift design
* Apply probabilistic forecasting to both existing wells and new drills, to be utilized in decision trees and appraisal program assessments and valuations
* Plan and execute drilling programs with multi-disciplinary team
* Analyze well tests and use surveillance techniques to assess well/field performance
* Help evaluate strategic acquisition/trade/divestiture opportunities
* Perform basic economic analyses and sensitivities as needed
* Provide justification and documentation for new reserve bookings


Qualifications & Experience
  
The successful candidate will have the following qualifications and experience:
  
  

* BS in Petroleum Engineering (or related engineering degree)
* minimum of 6 years of reservoir engineering experience with E&P Company
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well with multi-disciplinary team
* Experience building a development plan incorporating operational constraints associated with simultaneous operations, surface limitations for full field development, lift mechanism, and product takeaway capacity
* Experience assessing risk and uncertainty in unconventional reservoirs including the effect of depletion, inter well/bench spacing, and frac design on total value and hydrocarbon recovery
* Experience in evaluating and proposing data collection plans including but not limited to wireline log data, fiber optic, DFIT, oil allocation and interference tests for exploration, appraisal, and development phases of unconventional reservoirs
* Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and consistently meet project deadlines
* Must be detail-oriented
* Self-starter and able to accomplish tasks with minimal supervision
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills; must be able to present to executive-level audience
* Experience using database, engineering, and geoscience software, including Harmony, StimPlan, ResFrac, PetroVR, Spotfire, Mosaic Competencies


The successful candidate should demonstrate and exhibit the following core competencies:
  
**Communication:** Writes, speaks, and presents information effectively and persuasively across communication setting;
  
**Results:** Pursues work with energy, drive, and results orientation to positively impact Apache's business success;
  
**Collaboration:** Works in partnership with others and encourages different perspectives, while building and maintaining trust; and
  
**Culture:** Willingness and ability to align one's behavior with the needs, priorities, and goals of Apache. Company Overview
  
Our primary product is energy, and where there is affordable, abundant energy, people are given greater opportunities to elevate their families to higher standards of living. We are committed to providing oil and natural gas in more innovative and sustainable ways to help meet the world's energy needs.
  
Apache Corporation is a wholly owned subsidiary of APA Corporation (NASDAQ: APA). Apache and other affiliated subsidiaries have operations in the United States, Egypt and the United Kingdom's North Sea and exploration opportunities offshore Suriname and elsewhere.
  
For additional information about APA Corporation, please visit: www.apacorp.com . Apache Statement on Hiring
  
To provide genuine equal opportunity to all people, it is the policy of Apache Corporation and its subsidiaries to base all employment-related decisions and actions exclusively on employment-related criteria. To provide genuine equal opportunity to all people, it is the policy of Apache Corporation and its subsidiaries to provide broad dissemination of job opportunities, as consistent with the nature of the positions. title: Data Analyst - Chicago Strategic Action Council
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY** 

This position will manage and analyze data to inform and optimize the Chicago Strategic Action Council (CSAC) strategies and outcomes by ensuring data integrity and security while adapting to the needs of Chicago’s youth in underserved communities. This role requires secure, culturally sensitive data handling, with direct surveys, interviews, and local partnerships forming the basis of data sources. The comprehensive approach aims to support CSAC's mission through rigorous evaluation, strategy adaptation, and stakeholder reporting, aligning with objectives to aid youth in areas of substance misuse prevention and mental health promotion.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS** 

* Oversee bi-monthly data collection using SurveyMonkey, Google Forms, and other systems, ensuring comprehensive data capture; collect and preprocess large datasets to ensure accuracy and reliability for analysis.
* Analyze and interpret collected data to identify trends, insights, and impact measures, and prepare reports for stakeholders. May include metric reports, program-specific quarterly, and year-end reports.
* Implement and manage data security protocols, including encrypted storage and restricted access, to ensure data integrity and confidentiality. Monitor access controls and other security measures to mitigate risks.
* Ensure data collection methods are culturally sensitive and respectful of the communities served; continuously assess the effectiveness of data collection methods and make adjustments as needed to address any biases or limitations.
* Collaborate with project coordinators and other stakeholders to align data collection with project goals; solicit feedback to improve the inclusiveness of the process.
* Track and measure project performance against established metrics and goals; develop and refine data collection instruments to effectively capture relevant indicators.
* Participate in the Plan-Do-Study-Act (PDSA) cycles for ongoing quality improvement.
* Aid in the training of staff and partners on data management tools and practices, interpretations, and outcome evaluations.
* Continuously seek ways to improve data collection and analysis methods to better serve project objectives; stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analysis.
* Represents Prevention First on various internal, regional, and community-based committees; participates in all internal staff meetings, organizational retreats, and planning meetings.
* Demonstrates commitment to valuing diversity and equity and contributing to an inclusive working and learning environment.
* Operates basic office equipment and presentation technology; utilizes communications and conferencing platforms (e.g., Zoom, WebEx, Teams, etc.), internet access, internet search capabilities, PowerPoint, and other programs as needed; operates a motor vehicle. Prepares various reports and documents, including activity reports, quarterly and annual reports, etc.

**POSITION QUALIFICATIONS** 

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Data Management, Statistics, Education, Social Work, or a related field with a minimum of two to four years of related experience in data collection and analysis, violence prevention, youth development, facilitating or delivering trainings, project management coordinating technical assistance, strategic planning and performing related tasks; or any equivalent combination of education, training, and experience which provides the requisite knowledge, skills, and abilities for this job.

* Creative - Ability to produce new concepts, ideas and solutions.
* Goal Oriented - Ability to focus on a goal and obtain a pre-determined result.
* Communication Skills – Ability to organize and convey ideas clearly in writing and verbally.
* Critical Thinking – Ability to analyze and evaluate an issue in order to form a judgment.
* Interpersonal - Ability to get along well with a variety of personalities and individuals.

**ABOUT PREVENTION FIRST**

Prevention First is a nonprofit and the leading organization for knowledge-building and the dissemination of evidence-based prevention strategies. Our mission is to advance efforts to promote healthy behaviors and prevent substance misuse in every community through a variety of evidence-based and collaborative approaches, including training, support, and public awareness. We specialize in building the capacity of practitioners to build and sustain effective community coalitions to prevent substance abuse, develop comprehensive strategic prevention plans, and select and implement appropriate evidence-based prevention strategies. Prevention First is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
